verses.verse: Better <S%H2896><s%> is a dry <S%H2720><s%> morsel <S%H6595><s%>, and quietness <S%H7962><s%> therewith, than an house <S%H1004><s%> full <S%H4392><s%> of sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> with strife <S%H7379><s%>.

A wise <S%H7919><s%> servant <S%H5650><s%> shall have rule <S%H4910><s%> over a son <S%H1121><s%> that causeth shame <S%H954><s%>, and shall have part <S%H2505><s%> of the inheritance <S%H5159><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the brethren <S%H251><s%>.
The fining pot <S%H4715><s%> is for silver <S%H3701><s%>, and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold <S%H2091><s%>: but the LORD <S%H3068><s%> trieth <S%H974><s%> the hearts <S%H3826><s%>.
A wicked doer <S%H7489><s%> giveth heed <S%H7181><s%> to false <S%H205><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%>; and a liar <S%H8267><s%> giveth ear <S%H238><s%> to a naughty <S%H1942><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%>.

Whoso mocketh <S%H3932><s%> the poor <S%H7326><s%> reproacheth <S%H2778><s%> his Maker <S%H6213><s%>: and he that is glad <S%H8056><s%> at calamities <S%H343><s%> shall not be unpunished <S%H5352><s%>.
Children's <S%H1121><s%> children <S%H1121><s%> are the crown <S%H5850><s%> of old men <S%H2205><s%>; and the glory <S%H8597><s%> of children <S%H1121><s%> are their fathers <S%H1><s%>.
Excellent <S%H3499><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> becometh <S%H5000><s%> not a fool <S%H5036><s%>: much less do lying <S%H8267><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> a prince <S%H5081><s%>.
A gift <S%H7810><s%> is as a precious <S%H2580><s%> stone <S%H68><s%> in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of him that hath <S%H1167><s%> it: whithersoever it turneth <S%H6437><s%>, it prospereth <S%H7919><s%>.

He that covereth <S%H3680><s%> a transgression <S%H6588><s%> seeketh <S%H1245><s%> love <S%H160><s%>; but he that repeateth <S%H8138><s%> a matter <S%H1697><s%> separateth <S%H6504><s%> very friends <S%H441><s%>.
A reproof <S%H1606><s%> entereth <S%H5181><s%> more into a wise man <S%H995><s%> than an hundred <S%H3967><s%> stripes <S%H5221><s%> into a fool <S%H3684><s%>.
An evil <S%H7451><s%> man seeketh <S%H1245><s%> only rebellion <S%H4805><s%>: therefore a cruel <S%H394><s%> messenger <S%H4397><s%> shall be sent <S%H7971><s%> against him.
Let a bear <S%H1677><s%> robbed <S%H7909><s%> of her whelps meet <S%H6298><s%> a man <S%H376><s%>, rather than <S%H408><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> in his folly <S%H200><s%>.
Whoso rewardeth <S%H7725><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> for good <S%H2896><s%>, evil <S%H7451><s%> shall not depart <S%H4185><s%> <S%H4185><s%> from his house <S%H1004><s%>.

The beginning <S%H7225><s%> of strife <S%H4066><s%> is as when one letteth out <S%H6362><s%> water <S%H4325><s%>: therefore leave off <S%H5203><s%> contention <S%H7379><s%>, before <S%H6440><s%> it be meddled <S%H1566><s%> with.

He that justifieth <S%H6663><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, and he that condemneth <S%H7561><s%> the just <S%H6662><s%>, even they both <S%H8147><s%> are abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
Wherefore is there a price <S%H4242><s%> in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> to get <S%H7069><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, seeing he hath no heart <S%H3820><s%> to it?
A friend <S%H7453><s%> loveth <S%H157><s%> at all times <S%H6256><s%>, and a brother <S%H251><s%> is born <S%H3205><s%> for adversity <S%H6869><s%>.

A man <S%H120><s%> void <S%H2638><s%> of understanding <S%H3820><s%> striketh <S%H8628><s%> hands <S%H3709><s%>, and becometh <S%H6148><s%> surety <S%H6161><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of his friend <S%H7453><s%>.

He loveth <S%H157><s%> transgression <S%H6588><s%> that loveth <S%H157><s%> strife <S%H4683><s%>: and he that exalteth <S%H1361><s%> his gate <S%H6607><s%> seeketh <S%H1245><s%> destruction <S%H7667><s%>.

He that hath a froward <S%H6141><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> findeth <S%H4672><s%> no good <S%H2896><s%>: and he that hath a perverse <S%H2015><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> falleth <S%H5307><s%> into mischief <S%H7451><s%>.
He that begetteth <S%H3205><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> doeth it to his sorrow <S%H8424><s%>: and the father <S%H1><s%> of a fool <S%H5036><s%> hath no joy <S%H8055><s%>.
A merry <S%H8056><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> doeth good <S%H3190><s%> like a medicine <S%H1456><s%>: but a broken <S%H5218><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> drieth <S%H3001><s%> the bones <S%H1634><s%>.
A wicked <S%H7563><s%> man taketh <S%H3947><s%> a gift <S%H7810><s%> out of the bosom <S%H2436><s%> to pervert <S%H5186><s%> the ways <S%H734><s%> of judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is before him that hath understanding <S%H6440><s%> <S%H995><s%>; but the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> are in the ends <S%H7097><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.
A foolish <S%H3684><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> is a grief <S%H3708><s%> to his father <S%H1><s%>, and bitterness <S%H4470><s%> to her that bare <S%H3205><s%> him.
Also to punish <S%H6064><s%> the just <S%H6662><s%> is not good <S%H2896><s%>, nor to strike <S%H5221><s%> princes <S%H5081><s%> for equity <S%H3476><s%>.

He that hath <S%H3045><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%> spareth <S%H2820><s%> his words <S%H561><s%>: and a man <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H8394><s%> is of an excellent <S%H3368><s%> <S%H7119><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%>.

Even a fool <S%H191><s%>, when he holdeth his peace <S%H2790><s%>, is counted <S%H2803><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%>: and he that shutteth <S%H331><s%> his lips <S%H8193><s%> is esteemed a man of understanding <S%H995><s%>.
